ul.li:
Include these codes as defined in https://fhir.dk.swisstph-mis.ch/matchbox/fhir/CodeSystem/emcare-custom-codes
CodeDisplayDefinition
EmCare.B3.DE05is the child sick today?The client's visit is for a well child but the child is also presenting as sick
EmCare.B7.DE02convulsing nowThe client is convulsing now
EmCare.B7-B8-B9.DE01continue to assess sick childThe healthcare worker chooses if they will continue to assess the sick child with a life threatening illness
EmCare.B7.DE03convulsion(s) in this illnessThe client is reported to have had one or more convulsions
EmCare.B7.DE08bunconscious or lethargicThe client is unconcious or Lethargic
EmCare.B7.DE08unconsciousThe client is unconcious
EmCare.B7.DE08alethargicThe client is lethargic
EmCare.B7.DE09not able to drink or breastfeedThe client has reported not to have been able to drink or breastfeed or currently is not able to drink or breastfeed.
EmCare.B7.DE10vomiting everythingThe client is reported to be vomiting everything or vomiting but not everything or no vomiting
EmCare.B6.DE01axillary temperature (degrees celcius)The client's axillary temperature in degrees Celsius (temperature taken under the armpit)
EmCare.B6.DE04thermometer not availableA thermometer is not available to accurately measure the client's temperature
EmCare.B6.DE05hot to touchThe client is hot to touch
EmCare.B6.DE01Ameasured temperatureThe client's Temperature has been measured
EmCare.B6.DE06weight (kg)The client's weight in Kilograms
EmCare.B6.DE08estimated weightThe client's weight has been estimated - to be used for treatment dosing only
EmCare.B6.DE09heightThe client's height in Centimeters
EmCare.B6.DE11height cannot be measuredThe client's height cannot be measured
EmCare.B6.DE12lengthThe client's length in Centimeters
EmCare.B6.DE16weight for age (wfa) z scoresThe client's weight for age z score
EmCare.B6.DE17muac (mm)The client's Mid Upper Arm Circumference in Millimeters (child â‰¥6 months old)
EmCare.B6.DE17amuac cannot be measuredThe client's Mid Upper Arm Circumference cannot be measured
EmCare.B6.DE18visually assess for whether underweight (for drug dose calculation)The health care worker visually assesses for whether underweight (for drug dosing calculations)
EmCare.B18S1.DE02difficulty with feedingThe client is reported to have difficulty with Feeding
EmCare.B11S1.DE01diarrhoeaThe client is reported to have diarrhoea
EmCare.B21S1.DE06breastfedThe client is breastfed
EmCare.B18S2.DE07severe chest indrawingThe client has severe chest indrawing
EmCare.B18S2.DE08movementsThe health care worker's assessments of the client's movements
EmCare.B18S2.DE12umbilicus red or pus drainingThe client's umbilicus is red or is draining pus
EmCare.B18S2.DE13skin pustulesThe client has skin pustules
EmCare.B19S2.DE01yellow skinThe client has yellow skin
EmCare.B19S2.DE02yellow palms or yellow solesThe client has yellow palms or yellow soles
EmCare.B19S2.DE04when did the jaundice first appear?The age at which the Jaundice first appeared
EmCare.B11S2.DE01sunken eyesThe client has sunken eyes
EmCare.B11S2.DE02skin pinch of abdomenThe healthcare worker pinches the skin of the client's abdomen for 1 second and then observes how long the skin takes to return to normal once released
EmCare.B11S2.DE06restless and irritableThe client is restless and irritable
EmCare.B21S2.DE01weight statusThe client's weight status
EmCare.B21S2.DE05breastfed how many times in 24 hours?Number of times the client is breastfed in 24 hours
EmCare.B21S2.DE06sufficient feedsBased on the number of feeds during a 24 hour period the result is auto-calculated to determine sufficient feeds
EmCare.B21S2.DE08young infant receives food or fluids other than breast milkThe client is receiving other food or drinks besides breastmilk
EmCare.B21S2.DE09what milk is being given as a replacement feed?The health care worker discusses the milk being given to the client as a replacement feed and determines if it is appropriate replacement milk
EmCare.B21S2.DE12how many replacement feeds during the day and night (24 hours)?How often the client is receiving replacement feeds during the day and night (24 hours)
EmCare.B21S2.DE13sufficient replacement feeds (in 24 hours)Based on the number of feeds during the day and night (24 hours) the result is auto-calculated to determine sufficient replacement feeds
EmCare.B21S2.DE15how much milk is given at each feed (ml)?The amount of milk given to the client at each feed
EmCare.B21S2.DE16sufficient replacement feedsThe care giver is giving sufficient replacement feeds
EmCare.B21S2.DE18how is the milk prepared?Description of how the milk is prepared for the client's feed
EmCare.B21S2.DE21how is the milk given?Description on how the client is given the milk - bottle or cup
EmCare.B21S2.DE24how are the feeding utensils cleaned?Description of how the feeding utensils are cleaned
EmCare.B21S2.DE27do you give any breastmilk at all?Does the care giver give the client any breastmilk at all?
EmCare.B21S2.DE30ulcers or white patches in mouthThe client has ulcers or white patches in the mouth
EmCare.B21S2.DE31unable to check if ulcers or white patches in mouthThe healthcare worker is unable to check if the client has ulcers or white patches in the mouth
EmCare.B10S1.DE05coughThe client is reported to have or has had a cough
EmCare.B10S1.DE06cough for how long?Length of time the client is reported to have or has had the cough
EmCare.B10S1.DE01difficulty breathingThe client is reported to have or has had difficulty breathing
EmCare.B10S1.DE02difficulty breathing for how long?The length of time the client has or has had difficulty breathing
EmCare.B11S1.DE02diarrhoea for how long?The length of time the client is reported to have or has had diarrhoea
EmCare.B11S1.DE05blood in the stool in this illnessThe client is reported to have or has had blood in the stool in this Illness
EmCare.B12S1.DE02fever reportedThe client is reported to have or has had fever
EmCare.B12S1.DE03fever for how long?
EmCare.B.G.DE06fever
EmCare.B12S1.DE06has fever been present every day since the fever started?The client has had fever present every day since the fever started
EmCare.B13S1.DE01ear problemThe client is reported to have had or has an ear problem
EmCare.B13S1.DE02ear painThe client is reported to have had or has ear pain
EmCare.B13S1.DE03ear dischargeThe client is reported to have or has had ear discharge
EmCare.B13S1.DE04ear discharge for how long?The length of time client has or has had ear discharge
EmCare.B14S1.DE03eye problemThe client is reported to have an eye problem
EmCare.B14S1.DE01skin problemThe client is reported to have or has had a skin problem
EmCare.B14S1.DE02itchy skinThe client is reported to have itchy skin
EmCare.B10S2.DE03chest indrawingThe client has chest indrawing
EmCare.B10S2.DE04stridor in a calm childThe client has stridor in a calm child while the client is at rest
EmCare.B10S2.DE05wheezingThe client is wheezing
EmCare.B10S2.DE06recurrent wheezeThe client has experienced recurrent wheeze
EmCare.B10S2.DE07oxygen saturationThe client's oxygen saturation measurement
EmCare.B17S1.DE01throat problemThe client has a throat problem
EmCare.B17S1.DE02specify throat problemSpecify the throat problem the client has
EmCare.B17S1.DE06enlarged lymph nodes on front of neckThe client has enlarged lymph node(s) on the front of the neck
EmCare.B17S1.DE07ability to swallowThe client's ability to swallow
EmCare.B13S2.DE01tender swelling behind the earThe client has tender swelling behind the ear
EmCare.B13S2.DE02pus seen draining from the earThe client has pus draining from the ear which has been seen by the health care worker
EmCare.B13S2.DE03pus seen draining from the ear for how long?The length of time the client has or has had pus draining from the ear
EmCare.B12S2.DE01stiff neckThe client has a stiff neck
EmCare.B12S2.DE05runny noseThe client has a Runny nose
EmCare.B14S2.DE01red eyesThe client has red eyes
EmCare.B14S2.DE02pus draining from eyeThe client has pus draining from the eye
EmCare.B14S2.DE03clouding of the corneaThe client has clouding of the cornea
EmCare.B14S2.DE04is clouding of the cornea a new problemClouding of the cornea in the client is a new problem
EmCare.B14S2.DE05has clouding of the cornea previously been treatedClouding of the cornea has not been previously treated in the client
EmCare.B14S2.DE06generalised or localised skin problemThe client has a generalised or localised skin problem
EmCare.B14S2.DE10measles rashThe client has a measles rash
EmCare.B14S2.DE11measles within the last 3 monthsThe client has had measles in the last 3 months
EmCare.B14S2.DE12blisters, sores or pustulesThe client has blisters, sores or pustules
EmCare.B14S2.DE13type of skin problemThe client has a specific type of skin problem(s)
EmCare.B14S2.DE19ascalp infection (tinea capitis)The client has Scalp Infection (tinea capitis)
EmCare.B14S2.DE22Asevere rashThe client has severe chickenpox rash
EmCare.B14S2.DE23adisseminated herpes zosterThe client has disseminated herpes zoster
EmCare.B14S2.DE24eye involvementThe client has Herpes Zoster with Eye Involvement
EmCare.B14S2.DE30skin infection extends to muscleThe client has skin infection that extends to muscle
EmCare.B14S2.DE30bextensive impetigo lesionsThe client has Extensive impetigo lesions requiring oral antibiotics
EmCare.B14S2.DE31aextensive molluscum lesionsThe client has Extensive molluscum lesions
EmCare.B14S2.DE31bmolluscum lesions close to the eyeThe client has molluscum lesions close to the eye
EmCare.B14S2.DE32aextensive wartsThe client has Extensive warts
EmCare.B14S2.DE34severe seborrhoeic dermatitisThe client has severe Seborrhoeic Dermatitis
EmCare.B14S2.DE36asecondary bacterial infection of eczemaThe client has secondary bacterial infection of eczema
EmCare.B14S2.DE36bsevere acute moist or weeping eczemaThe client has severe acute moist or weeping eczema
EmCare.B14S2.DE36csecondary herpes infection of eczema (eczema herpeticum)The client has secondary herpes infection of eczema (eczema herpeticum)
EmCare.B14S2.DE38oral sores or mouth ulcersThe client has oral sores or mouth ulcers
EmCare.B14S2.DE43add a skin or mouth or eye problemThe health care worker would like to add a Skin or Mouth or Eye problem found during the physical exam
EmCare.B15S2.DE01palmar pallorThe client has palmar pallor
EmCare.B15S2.DE09mucous membrane pallorThe client has Mucous membrane pallor
EmCare.B22.DE08oral fluid test resultsOral Fluid Test Results
EmCare.B22.DE14unable to perform oral fluid testThe healthcare worker is Unable to Perform Oral Fluid Test
EmCare.B22.DE14acompletely unable to drink or vomits immediately / everythingWhen are present when the healthcare worker is Unable to Perform Oral Fluid Test it is assumed that the client is completely unable to drink or vomits immediately / everything
EmCare.B22.DE15has the child had anything to drink today?The health care worker asks the caregiver if the client has had anything to drink today
EmCare.B22.DE16how did the child last drinkThe health care worker asks the caregiver how did the client last drink
EmCare.B22.DE01respiratory rate (breaths per minute)The client's respiratory rate for client's aged 2 months or more
EmCare.B22.DE02unable to perform respiratory rate at this timeThe client's respiratory rate could not be measured at this time (all ages)
EmCare.B22.DE04respiratory rate second count (breaths per minute)The client's respiratory rate for the second Count
EmCare.B22.DE05respiratory rate second count not possibleThe client's respiratory rate for the second Count was not possible
EmCare.B22.DE07fast breathingThe client has fast breathing - auto-calculated based on the respiratory rate and the age of the client - 60 breaths per minute or more (<2 months) after 2 respiratory rate measurements
EmCare.B22.DE17inhaled bronchodilator trial resultsThe Inhaled bronchodilator trial test results
EmCare.B22.DE22inhaled bronchodilator trial not feasible or available
EmCare.B22.DE21no fast breathing and no chest indrawing (post inhaled bronchodilator trial)The client has no fast breathing and no chest indrawing
EmCare.B22.DE41breastfeeding assessment not possibleThe breastfeeding assessment was not possible
EmCare.B22.DE28breastfed in the previous hourThe client has breastfed in the previous hour
EmCare.B22.DE29mother able to wait until young infant is willing to breastfeed againThe client's mother is able to wait until young infant is willing to breastfeed again
EmCare.B22.DE30mother reports difficulty breastfeedingThe client's mother reports that there is difficulty breastfeeding (not observed)
EmCare.B22.DE31chin touching breastThe client's chin is touching the breast
EmCare.B22.DE32mouth wide openThe client's mouth is wide open
EmCare.B22.DE33lower lip turned outwardsThe client's lower lip is turned outwards
EmCare.B22.DE34more areola visible above than below the mouthThe mother has more areola visible above than below the client's mouth
EmCare.B22.DE35slow deep sucks, sometimes pausingThe client is taking slow deep sucks, sometimes pausing
EmCare.B22.DE36breastfeeding assessment resultsThe client's breastfeeding results
EmCare.B22.DE42difficulty breastfeeding reportedThe breastfeeding assessment was not observed however the caregiver has reported difficulty breastfeeding
EmCare.B22.DE44difficulty breastfeeding observedThe healthcare worker has observed that the client has difficulty breastfeeding
EmCare.B22.DE81hemoglobin (hb) g/dl
EmCare.B22.DE82hemoglobin test not available
EmCare.B22.DE47axillary temperature (second measurement)The client's axillary temperature (second measurement) in degrees Celcius (temperature taken under the armpit)
EmCare.B22.DE46second temperature measurement not feasibleThe client's second temperature measurement is feasible
EmCare.B22.DE50measured temperature (second measurement)

description.value: Codes representing possible values for the Provide an estimated age or estimated date of birth element

value.value: The client's visit is for a well child but the child is also presenting as sick
The client is convulsing now
The healthcare worker chooses if they will continue to assess the sick child with a life threatening illness
The client is reported to have had one or more convulsions
The client is unconcious or Lethargic
The client is unconcious
The client is lethargic

value.value: Number of times the client is breastfed in 24 hours

value.value: The client is receiving other food or drinks besides breastmilk

value.value: The health care worker discusses the milk being given to the client as a replacement feed and determines if it is appropriate replacement milk

value.value: How often the client is receiving replacement feeds during the day and night (24 hours)

value.value: The amount of milk given to the client at each feed

value.value: Does the care giver give the client any breastmilk at all?

value.value: The health care worker asks the caregiver if the client has had anything to drink today

no fast breathing and no chest indrawing (post inhaled bronchodilator trial)
